article.headline: Hofstra 76, Drexel 75 (OT)
article.story: PHILADELPHIA (AP) -- Carlos Rivera hit three free throws with 6.2 seconds remaining in overtime to lift Hofstra to a 76-75 win over Drexel on Saturday. Rivera scored eight of Hofstra's nine points in overtime as the Pride (14-4, 7-3 Colonial Athletic Association) escaped with their fourth win in the last five games. Rivera hit a 3-pointer with 17.7 seconds remaining to cut Drexel's lead to 75-73. He was fouled while attempting another 3-pointer and hit all three shots. Antoine Agudio led Hofstra with 19 points. Rivera finished with 15 points as all five Hofstra starters scored in double digits. Aurimas Kieza pulled down a game-high 13 rebounds. Drexel's Bashir Mason scored 19 points for the Dragons (12-10, 6-5) and Crawford and Matt Stevenson each scored 15 points. Rivera's first basket in overtime came on a layup to cut Drexel's lead to 73-69 with 1:08 remaining in overtime. The Dragons scored the first six points in overtime to take a 73-67 lead as Mason and Dominick Mejia each hit a 3-pointer to cap off a 12-0 run. The Dragons trailed by as many as seven points in the second half, but Mason hit a free throw with 1:03 remaining in regulation to tie the game 67-67 and send it to overtime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
